description: The Democratic National Convention is set to begin Monday in Chicago, where President Biden, former first lady Michelle Obama and former Presidents Barack Obama and Bill Clinton are all scheduled to speak. Ed O'Keefe has more.
title: Final preparations being made for DNC in Chicago

description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Weekend News" with Jericka Duncan.
title: "CBS Weekend News" headlines for Sunday Aug. 18, 2024

description: Thousands of gallons of jet fuel contaminated the Navy's drinking water system for Pearl Harbor. Families dealing with health issues sued, alleging they were harmed by negligence at Red Hill.
title: Military families feel betrayed over jet fuel-tainted water at Hawaii base

description: Indian Relay, dubbed "America's original extreme sport," has roots dating back centuries to horse stealing raids. Native Americans are keeping the dangerous and compelling racing tradition alive.
title: Indian Relay horse races have historic roots for Native American tribes

description: Millions of landmines are spread across Ukraine. A massive effort is underway to find and remove the deadly devices, but it will take a generation or more to be rid of them.
title: Massive Ukrainian effort underway to clear millions of landmines

description: Ukraine has been littered with millions of landmines since Russia's invasion began two years ago. A humanitarian group says clearing them will take "generations."
title: Ukraine's landmine crisis

description: Indian Relay, dubbed “America's original extreme sport,” has roots dating back centuries to horse stealing raids. Native Americans are keeping the dangerous and compelling racing tradition alive.
title: Indian Relay horse race dubbed “America's original extreme sport” | 60 Minutes

description: Millions of landmines are spread across Ukraine. A massive effort is underway to find and remove the deadly devices, but it will take a generation or more to be rid of them.
title: Deadly landmines plague Ukraine after Russia’s invasion | 60 Minutes

description: Thousands of gallons of jet fuel contaminated the Navy's drinking water system for Pearl Harbor. Families dealing with health issues sued, alleging they were harmed by negligence at Red Hill.
title: Military families in Hawaii say water tainted by jet fuel made them sick | 60 Minutes

description: Here's how and when to watch the New Orleans Saints face the San Francisco 49es for NFL preseason Week 2 tonight.
title: How to watch tonight's Saints vs. 49ers NFL preseason game

description: Rep. Mike Turner, chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, said Iran could declare itself a nuclear weapons state "by the end of the year."
title: Rep. Turner says Iran could be a nuclear weapons state "by the end of the year"

description: Here's how and when to watch the Green Bay Packers face the Denver Broncos for NFL preseason Week 2 tonight.
title: How to watch today's Packers vs. Broncos NFL preseason game

description: Democrats are returning to Chicago this week for their convention, with the prospect of protests evoking memories of the violent clashes at the 1968 convention in the same city. Tensions were also high inside the 1968 convention, where Dan Rather was prevented from speaking to a participant.
title: Prospect of protests at Chicago DNC evokes memories of 1968 convention violence

description: John Aprea landed his first break in the 1967 Steve McQueen classic "Bullitt" before landing the role of young Salvatore "Sal" Tessio in "The Godfather Part II."
title: John Aprea, "The Godfather Part II" and "Full House" actor, dies at 83

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," as the Democrats get ready for their convention in Chicago, Sen. Mark Kelly and Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear join. Plus, CBS News executive director of elections and surveys Anthony Salvanto discets the latest 2024 presidential poll.
title: 8/18: Face the Nation

description: On this "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" broadcast, Sen. Mark Kelly and Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear join Margaret Brennan.
title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Aug. 18, 2024

description: Austan Goolsbee, the president and CEO of the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," that he doesn't think it's a "certainty" that the Federal Reserve will lower interest rates in September. "We've been making clear for a while what economic conditions would be appropriate for us to cut rates, for us to hold rates where and they are and things like that."
title: Austan Goolsbee says it isn't a "certainty" that Fed will lower interest rates in Sept.

description: Following the arrests last week in connection with Matthew Perry's death from a ketamine overdose, DEA administrator Anne Milgram on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" compares ketamine abuse to the beginning of the opioid epidemic, and says the DEA is targeting doctors and practitioners "who are violating this duty of trust to their patients by over-prescribing medicine, or prescribing medicine that isn't necessary."
title: DEA's Anne Milgram compares ketamine abuse with beginning of opioid epidemic

description: Democratic Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that Vice President Kamala Harris' plan to enact stricter penalties on price gouging is similar to ones filed by state attorneys general. "This isn't about trying to price fix," Beshear said.
title: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear says Harris' plan to stop gouging "isn't about trying to price fix"

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with House Intelligence Committee chairman Rep. Mike Turner, Republican of Ohio, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Aug. 18, 2024.
title: Transcript: House Intelligence Committee chair Rep. Mike Turner on "Face the Nation," Aug. 18, 2024

description: Missed the second half of the show? The latest on... the 2024 Presidential Election, U.S. economy and the medicinal use of ketamine
title: Face the Nation: Beshear, Goolsbee, Milgram

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with DEA administrator Anne Milgram on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Aug. 18, 2024.
title: Transcript: DEA administrator Anne Milgram on "Face the Nation," Aug. 18, 2024

description: Republican Rep. Mike Turner of Ohio, the chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that there are reports that Iran could "declare itself a nuclear weapons state by the end of the year."
title: Rep. Mike Turner says Iran could "declare itself a nuclear weapons state" by end of 2024

description: Democratic Sen. Mark Kelly of Arizona tells "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that he believes that once former President Donald Trump is "done and gone," the Senate Republicans who, once Trump denounced it, abandoned the immigration bill will once again support it.
title: Sen. Mark Kelly says when Trump is "done and gone," Senate GOP will support immigration bill

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Austan Goolsbee, president of Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Aug. 18, 2024.
title: Transcript: Austan Goolsbee, president of federal reserve bank of Chicago, on "Face the Nation," Aug. 18, 2024

description: The DNC, where Kamala Harris will officially be recognized as the Democratic nominee, takes place this week in Chicago.
title: The 2024 Democratic National Convention starts tomorrow. Here's what to know.

description: The bridge attacks, apparently aimed at thwarting a Russian counter-push in Kursk, could mean that Kyiv intends to seek a foothold in the region.
title: Ukrainian forces strike 2 key bridges in Russia's Kursk area

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear, a Democrat, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Aug. 18, 2024.
title: Transcript: Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear on "Face the Nation," Aug. 18, 2024

description: As the Democrats prepare to head into their convention in Chicago, a new CBS News 2024 presidential poll shows that Kamala Harris' entry into the race pulled the party into an effectively even race with Donald Trump and Republicans, and it has continued to motivate Democrats to vote today. CBS News executive director of elections and surveys Anthony Salvanto joins "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" to break down the latest poll.
title: CBS News poll: Gender gap, enthusiasm and economy make for a tight Harris-Trump race on DNC eve

description: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," as the Democrats get ready for their convention in Chicago, Sen. Mark Kelly and Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear join. Plus, CBS News executive director of elections and surveys Anthony Salvanto discets the latest 2024 presidential poll.
title: Open: This is "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Aug. 18, 2024

description: The following is a transcript of an interview with Sen. Mark Kelly, Democrat of Arizona, on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" that aired on Aug. 18, 2024.
title: Transcript: Sen. Mark Kelly on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," Aug. 18. 2024

description: Major Ashley Henson of the Paulding County Sherriff's Office said the deputies were "ambushed."
title: Georgia deputy killed while responding to a domestic dispute call

description: We leave you this Sunday along the sandy shore of Lake Michigan, at Illinois Beach State Park. Videographer: Jamie McDonald.
title: Nature: Lake Michigan

description: In his new book, "At War With Ourselves: My Tour of Duty in the Trump White House," the retired Lt. Gen. discusses the 13 months he worked as Trump's national security adviser.
title: Former aide H.R. McMaster on how Trump enjoys "pitting people against each other"

description: In his new book, "At War With Ourselves: My Tour of Duty in the Trump White House," retired Lt. Gen. H.R. McMaster discusses the 13 months he served as national security adviser in the White House before former President Donald Trump fired him. McMaster talks with CBS News national security correspondent David Martin about working in a White House where "everything was much harder than it needed to be"; about Trump's attraction to the qualities of autocrats; and how he participated in an intervention to prevent Trump from threatening fellow members of NATO.
title: H.R. McMaster on 13 months working for Trump

description: His comic novels set in Florida target the darkness which can cloud the Sunshine State. Now, Hiaasen's 2013 bestseller about a failed detective, murder, and a misbehaving monkey is an Apple TV+ series starring Vince Vaughn.
title: Carl Hiaasen on "Bad Monkey" becoming a TV series

description: Florida native Carl Hiaasen has written about his beloved state in a series of bestselling comedic novels that target the darkness which can cloud the Sunshine State. "60 Minutes' correspondent Lesley Stahl talks with Hiaasen about his love affair with Florida; and visits the Florida Keys location of "Bad Monkey," a new Apple TV+ series adapted from Hiaasen's 2013 bestseller about a failed detective, murder, and a misbehaving monkey.
title: Author Carl Hiaasen on his love for Florida

description: When coal was king, coal miners risked their lives to fuel America. Photographer Russell Lee captured the hardships and privations (as well as moments of joy) in America's mining communities in the mid-1940s. His pictures are now on display at the National Archives in Washington, D.C., in an exhibit titled "Power & Light: Russell Lee's Coal Survey." "Sunday Morning" host Jane Pauley offers us a tour.
title: Photographer Russell Lee's testament to coal miners

description: The Shiveluch volcano spewed an ash column as high as 5 mils above sea level and released a gush of lava, TASS reported Sunday morning.
title: Volcano erupts in Russia after powerful magnitude-7.0 earthquake

description: Coal mining has always been a dangerous job, with one in every five miners ending up with "black lung" disease. But today, in Appalachia, miners are suffering from black lung at increasingly younger ages. "Sunday Morning" senior contributor Ted Koppel talks with miners and union officials who say coal companies routinely break the rules that could help protect their employees' health; and looks at a new government proposal that might offer real protection for miners, but which is facing opposition in Congress. (This story was originally broadcast December 10, 2023.)
title: Young coal miners suffering from black lung

description: "Sunday Morning" remembers some of the notable figures who left us this week, including two-time Oscar-nominated actress Gena Rowlands ("A Woman Under the Influence," "Gloria").
title: Passage: In memoriam

description: In her latest film, "Between the Temples," Oscar-nominated actress Carol Kane plays a retired music teacher who is determined to be bat mitzvahed. Kane talks with correspondent Nancy Giles about how her own mother inspired her character; how Andy Kaufman taught her the "language" that their characters, Latka and Simka, spoke on the TV series "Taxi"; and how, as a student, she resisted the opinion of a doctor who said she should never set foot on stage.
title: The distinctive voices of Carol Kane

description: The 53-year-old artist, whose mixed-media pieces celebrate women, is now being featured in an exhibition at the Broad Museum in Los Angeles titled "Mickalene Thomas: All About Love."
title: Artist Mickalene Thomas and her dream of making a difference

description: Originally from Africa, donkeys (or burros, in Spanish) have been in North America for centuries. They were work animals that helped build the West, and today there are thousands of free-roaming donkeys on public lands, where they can overgraze and threaten delicate ecosystems. Correspondent Conor Knighton looks at efforts (such as adoption programs for wild and domestic burros) aimed at giving these social animals a better life.
title: Giving wild donkeys a new life

description: In college Mickalene Thomas studied pre-law because she wanted to change the world. But then she saw an exhibition of photographs by Carrie Mae Weems, and she knew then what she wanted to do. The 53-year-old artist, who creates pieces celebrating women, is now being featured in an exhibition at the Broad Museum in Los Angeles titled "Mickalene Thomas: All About Love." Correspondent Tracy Smith talks with Thomas about her muses and her mixing of media, from collage and silkscreen to rhinestones.
title: The art of Mickalene Thomas

description: "Sunday Morning" looks back at historical events on this date.
title: Almanac: August 18

description: The longtime party figure and native Chicagoan previews this week's Democratic National Convention, and offers a message to his fellow Democrats about the prospects of the Harris-Walz ticket come Election Day.
title: Bill Daley on Democrats' prospects in 2024: "All of a sudden the cards have all been reshuffled"

description: The Democratic National Convention will be gaveled into session this Monday in Chicago, a city with a long, sometimes controversial history of Democratic nominating conventions. Longtime party figure and native Chicagoan Bill Daley offers CBS News chief election & campaign correspondent Robert Costa a message to his fellow Democrats about the prospects of the Kamala Harris-Tim Walz ticket come Election Day. [Watch CBS News' live anchored coverage starting Monday, August 19 at 5:00 p.m. ET, streaming on CBS News 24/7, Paramount+ and Pluto TV, with primetime coverage from 8:00-11:00 p.m. ET on CBS.]
title: A preview of the Democrats' convention in Chicago

description: Harris leads Trump nationally in CBS News 2024 presidential poll, but it's even across the battlegrounds.
title: Poll: Gender gap, enthusiasm, economy make for tight Harris-Trump race

description: The CBS News Battleground Tracker analysis includes our most updated estimates
title: 2024 Kamala Harris v. Donald Trump battleground state polling

description: The mediators have spent months trying to halt the fighting, efforts that gained new urgency amid rising fears of an all-out war across the Middle East.
title: Blinken heads to Middle East to help close Gaza cease-fire deal

description: A months-long downward trend in unauthorized border crossings has accelerated since President Biden's executive order took effect.
title: Under Biden policy, fewer migrants released into U.S. or screened for asylum

description: Alain Delon was able to combine toughness with an appealing, vulnerable quality that made him one of France's memorable leading men.
title: Alain Delon, French acting legend, dies at 88

description: Actor Jonathan Bailey sits down with Michelle Miller to discuss his on-screen romance roles in both "Bridgerton" and "Fellow Travelers." Then, Seth Doane travels to the Italian coastal town of Polignano a Mare to meet the athletes who compete in the thrilling sport of cliff diving. "Here Comes the Sun" is a closer look at some of the people, places and things we bring you every week on "CBS Sunday Morning."
title: Here Comes the Sun: Jonathan Bailey and more

description: When his parents disappear, Chandler Halderson’s social media helps investigators unravel the case. "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty reports.
title: The Snapchat Clue

description: Inside the mind of murderer Mark Twitchell — letters from the man police say wanted to be like fictional serial killer Dexter. "48 Hours" contributor Troy Roberts reports.
title: "The Dexter Killer"

description: Hurricane Ernesto lashes Bermuda; How a father-daughter’s home renovation became a story of resilience after loss
title: 8/17: CBS Weekend News

description: NASCAR heads to Michigan today for the FireKeepers Casino 400 Cup Series race. Find out how to watch and when.
title: How to watch today's FireKeepers Casino 400 NASCAR race

description: The Premier League Chelsea vs. Manchester City soccer game will be played today. Find out how and when to watch.
title: How to watch the Chelsea vs. Manchester City soccer game today

description: When Bart and Krista Halderson suddenly disappeared in July 2021, their son, Chandler, alerted police. A search of a popular social media app helped lead investigators to a gruesome discovery.
title: Did a Wisconsin man's lies lead to the murders of his parents?

description: The airstrike struck a house and an adjacent warehouse sheltering displaced people, according to local hospital officials.
title: At least 18 killed in Israeli airstrike on Gaza as more evacuations ordered

description: Mark Twitchell, a Canadian filmmaker, is dubbed "The Dexter Killer" because of the numerous links between the TV series and his real-life crimes.
title: Letters offer a rare look inside the mind of "The Dexter Killer"

description: During the rally, former President Donald Trump declared several times that he was better looking than Vice President Kamala Harris.
title: Trump remarks on economy laced with personal insults at Pennsylvania rally

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken is set to arrive in Israel this weekend ahead of a high stakes meeting to secure a cease-fire in the Israel-Hamas war, as negotiators hope for a diplomatic breakthrough. Ramy Inocencio has the latest from Tel Aviv.
title: Blinken heads to Israel as cease-fire talks continue

description: A fedora worn by actor Harrison Ford in the 1984 film "Indiana Jones and the Temple" sold at auction this week for a staggering $630,000.
title: Iconic fedora from "Indiana Jones" sells at auction

description: After months on the defensive, Ukrainian forces smashed across the Russian border, taking more than 400 square miles of territory, according to Kyiv, whose troops continue to pour into the Kursk region. Ian Lee reports from Kyiv.
title: Ukrainian troops push deeper into Russia

description: When Bridget McGaing and her father Bill began documenting their efforts to renovate an old home on the northwest side of Chicago on social media, they gained a huge following. But then the viral story about restoration soon became one of resilience after loss. Noel Brennan has more.
title: How a father-daughter's home renovation became a story of resilience after loss
